structure.unit: AID TO THE NEEDY BLIND -- EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

law.catch_line: Right of action -- Recovery for each violation.

text.section:
Any person aggrieved by a violation of KRS 207.135, 207.150, 207.160, or 304.12-013 shall have a right of action in District Court and may recover for each violation:
Against any person who violates a provision of this section, liquidated damages of one thousand dollars ($1,000) or actual damages, whichever is greater.
Against any person who intentionally or recklessly violates a provision of this section, liquidated damages of five thousand dollars ($5,000) or actual damages, whichever is greater.
Reasonable attorney's fees.
Such other relief, including an injunction, as the court shall deem appropriate.
Nothing in this section limits the right of the person aggrieved by a violation of this section to recover damages or other relief under any other applicable law.

law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 443, sec. 51, effective July 13, 1990.
